Description: Typical range for pulsed Nd:YAG laser cleaning of soft metals; conservative max to avoid melting Gallium (mp 29.8°C, high reflectivity ~70-90% at 1064 nm reduces absorption); starting at 50 W for light contamination removal without substrate damage. Source: Generalized from metal cleaning studies (e.g., Laser Cleaning of Metals, SPIE proceedings); specific Ga data limited, conservative estimate.
Near-IR wavelength for moderate Gallium absorption with good penetration
Optimal spot diameter for precise cleaning of Gallium surfaces
Balanced repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulses for controlled ablation of surface contaminants
Scan speed for efficient area coverage while maintaining cleaning effectiveness
Number of passes for complete contaminant removal without substrate damage
Optimal overlap between adjacent laser tracks for uniform cleaning
